etymology.description: Phonetic: 巳(巳) (sì, 'sixth earthly branch') + Semantic: 攴(攴) (pū, 'to tap') -> Phonetic changed to 己(己) (jǐ, 'self') -> final form meaning 'change; amend'
etymology.interpretation: The character 改(gǎi, 'change; alter; amend') originally combined the phonetic element 巳(巳) (sì, 'sixth earthly branch') with the semantic element 攴(攴) (pū, 'to tap'), suggesting a transformation or alteration process. The phonetic evolved to 己(己) (jǐ, 'self'), indicating a shift in representation while retaining the idea of making adjustments or amendments.

examples.chinese: 我改了计划(我改了計劃)。
政府决定改政策(政府決定改政策)，以适应新情况(以適應新情況)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngfǔ juédìng gǎi zhèngcè, yǐ shìyìng xīn qíngkuàng.
examples.english: The government decided to amend its policies to adapt to the new situation.
